title: Ticket #5554: Have docker universe report wall, CPU, and memory usage
description:
At the European HTCondor Workshop, Andrew Lahiff from RAL noted that they couldn't use the Docker universe more widely because it does not report wall or CPU usage - a requirement for WLCG reporting.

Wall time is fairly straightforward to derive (if nothing else, from docker inspect). Further, docker stats will get all the cgroup statistics from the container (which is a lot easier than trying to find the cgroup in a portable manner!).

I have copied a sample interaction below.

NOTE: This query takes about 2 seconds to perform. If you shutdown the unix socket after the HTTP GET request is sent - but before the response is received from the Docker daemon - the daemon will immediately return a HTTP 200 response with 0 length content.

Hence, if you're working with the raw API (which may be the only option as docker stats doesn't have a raw formatting option), you must not shutdown the client end of the Unix socket.

This shutdown issue is why the following example does not work with modern docker: 

echo -ne 'GET /v1.20/containers/fervent_poincare/stats?stream=0 HTTP/1.1\r\n\r\n' | nc -U /var/run/docker.sock

It does seem that very recent versions of `curl` (7.40 and later) can talk to a Unix socket directly; the version on RHEL7 appears to be too old.

Brian
